data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Of or relating to the study of the dynamics of projectiles.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Of or relating to the study of the internal action of firearms.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Of or relating to projectiles, their motion, or their effects.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: (go ballistic) To become very angry or irrational.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Pertaining to ballistics, or the scientific construction and use of projectiles.
Of or pertaining to the ballista, or to the art of hurling stones or missile weapons by means of an engine.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: Pertaining to ballistics{2}, or to a projectile in a gravitational field.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: frenzied; very angry; -- used mostly in the phrase go ballistic.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: an instrument consisting of a mass of wood or other material suspended as a pendulum, for measuring the force and velocity of projectiles by means of the arc through which their impact impels it.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.
